feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Alternate Reconciliation Account and Overwriting control accounts initiated by MM through ERS
entry.content:
I would like to ask the expert advice regarding "Alternate Reconciliation Account and Overwriting Reconciliation Accounts initiated by MM through ERS" .
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/0c67c30acde9468b9f1a43cae130a5a7.html?locale=en-US&version=LATESThttps://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/0c67c30acde9468b9f1a43cae130a5a7.html?locale=en-US

Query:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud,it appears to be explained that the use of alternate reconciliation accounts for control accounts from ERS(F1683) is not possible. I would like to inquire about the following:

  1. Is there a BAdI or similar functionality that exists for modifying liability details automatically recorded from ERS?
  2. Is it possible to forcibly overwrite reconciliation accounts by using Open FI?
    I would appreciate any guidance you can provide on this topic.
    Thank you for your support & Kindly Regards,

Koji Mikami

P.S
I discovered and tested the BAdI (MRM_ERS_DATA_Modify_CE), but Reconciliation Accounts were not included in the Changing Parameters. If there are any other methods, please let me know. Also, is there a possibility that an Alternate Reconciliation Account could be used in the future from ERS?
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/5a27c5f57c3f4dffa6881ca587b22571.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

entry.title: Calculation formulas for Statistical Key Figures in manufacturing overhead allocation
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We are implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for a manufacturing company and planning to use Statistical Key Figures for overhead cost allocation (e.g., allocating indirect costs based on production quantity, machine hours, inspection counts, etc.).

Could you please advise on the following:
1. What types of calculation formulas are available for Statistical Key Figures in overhead cost allocation?
2. Besides "Period-based Activity Price" and "Average Price", are there other calculation methods available?
3. In on-premise SAP, we used KP06 (cost input), KP26 (quantity input), and KSPI (price calculation) to automatically calculate activity prices. Is there an equivalent workflow in Public Edition?
4. If calculation formulas can be configured, which Scope Item and which Fiori app should be used for this setup?

Any guidance on activity-based costing setup in Public Edition would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Managing unconfirmed receivables/payables (before invoice posting) for cash flow forecasting
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We would like to reflect unconfirmed payment schedules (before Customer Invoice or Supplier Invoice posting) from purchase orders and sales orders into our cash flow forecast.

Specifically, we need to capture:
- Expected payment dates from purchase orders (before Supplier Invoice is posted)
- Expected receipt dates from sales orders (before Customer Invoice is posted)

Could you please advise:
1. Which Scope Item(s) support this functionality?
2. Which Fiori app(s) can be used to view/manage these unconfirmed payment schedules?
3. Can these schedules be automatically integrated with Cash Management for liquidity forecasting?
4. Which license is required for this functionality:
- "Basic Cash Management" or
- "SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (for Cash Management)"?
(Also, are these two licenses corresponding to Base Bundle and Premium Bundle respectively?)

Any guidance on extracting pending receivables/payables for cash flow planning would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Updating Custom Fields in Journal Entry in S4 Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to check if there is a way to update the Journal Entry custom fields after creating checks in Manage Outgoing Checks.
I have tested all available Journal Entry custom logic options, but none of them are triggered or update the custom fields.

I need this for a custom report in Create Correspondence, where the data from Manage Outgoing Checks must be reflected in the Journal Entry custom fields.

if you have any recommendations or alternative solutions, please let me know.

Thank you.

entry.title: Automatic bank statement import for Japanese banks in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We need to automatically import bank statements from Japanese banks into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for bank reconciliation.

Could you please advise:
1. Is automatic bank statement import supported for Japanese banks (e.g., MUFG, Mizuho, SMBC)?
2. Which connectivity method is supported:
- Bank Communication Management with Zengin format (Zengin TCP/IP or Zengin XML)?
- SWIFT/MT940?
- File upload (manual or SFTP)?
3. Which Scope Item(s) and Fiori app(s) should be used for this setup?
4. Are there any successful implementation cases with Japanese banks?

Any insights on Japanese bank integration would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Cash Management feature comparison: License types and Scope Items
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I'm trying to understand the Cash Management capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. According to the Help Portal (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/186460fdc35a4b64a713da9bb00deb1e/c7999f525c5b224fe10000000a445394.html), there are two different classifications:

**Scope Items:**
- Basic Cash Management
- SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (for Cash Management)

**License Bundles:**
- Finance Base
- Finance Premium

Could you please clarify:
1. What is the relationship between these Scope Items and License Bundles?
(e.g., Does "Basic Cash Management" correspond to "Finance Base"?)
2. What are the specific 3-digit Scope Item IDs (S-IDs) included in each Scope Item and License Bundle?
3. What are the key functional differences in Cash Flow Management across these combinations?

Any guidance or documentation references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Finished Good and Co-/By-Product Valuated at Zero After Production – Moving Average Price
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently working on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Manufacturing scenario) and I’m facing an issue with the inventory valuation after production.

Here is the situation:

  • I have a Finished Good (FG) with a Co-Product and a By-Product (used as a Semi-Finished Good).

  • I generated the BOM which includes the required raw materials.

  • In the Work Center, I assigned:

    • A Cost Center

    • Activity Types (Setup Time, Machine Time, Person Time)

    • Corresponding Rates for each activity type

  • I created a Production Order and during confirmation, the system correctly calculates the total cost (Raw Materials + Setup + Machine + Labor).

  • The cost of the FG and Co-Product is displayed correctly in the production order.

However, after performing the Goods Receipt (GR) for the FG and Co-Product, when I check the Inventory Valuation, I find that both are valuated at zero.
In the Production Order, the costs are correct, but the material valuation in stock is 0.

 

My Question:

How can I configure the system so that it updates the material valuation after production?
Is there any specific step or configuration (for example, settlement or revaluation process) required to make the inventory value reflect the actual production cost?

Note: I’m using Moving Average Price (V) as the control price for these materials.

Additional Info:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • Scenario: Production Order with Co-Products and By-Products

  • BOM and routing correctly maintained

  • Activity rates assigned in the work center

Thanks in advance for your help!
Any insight into configuration or post-processing steps would be appreciated.

entry.title: Multi-level sales order BOM
entry.content:
Hello,

Is there any way to create multi-level order BOM on standard SAP Public Cloud?
As far as I know, app Manage Order Bill Of Material (F4339A) only allows single level for sales order-specific BOM.

In details, their finished products consists of different components which are configurable or size-variable depending on customers' request. However client does not want to use variant configuration. And Public Cloud system does not allow more than 99 BOM alternatives and 99 group counters (please correct me if I'm wrong). That's why I am thinking of sales BOM. But now sales BOM seems not to be able to solve client's 6-level BOM.

Thanks in advanced.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Depreciation Keys Mexico
entry.content:
In the Public Cloud, we cannot create our own depreciation keys. For Mexico, the system currently provides:

  • MF05 – Straight-line 5.00% Mexico

  • ML10 – Straight-line 10.00% Mexico

  • ML20 – Straight-line 20.00% Mexico

However, we would also like to have 25%, 30%, and 35%.
Does anyone know a pragmatic solution for this?

entry.title: Good receipt and label printing for mixed purchase orders
entry.content:
Dear community,

we often have the issue of purchase orders with mixed item positions: Regular production material mixed with free text orders from purchase requisitions of end users in one purchase order.

 In this case there is no label printing possible for regular production material during goods reciept, only a document for Goods Receipt for PO is printed.

The workaround is to post incoming goods in 2 steps, 1st all freetext order items and 2nd all regular production material. But this means one must look into the entire item list of the purchase order to identify the freetext items, this is somehow cumbersome and laborious.

Is there a smarter way to achieve the printing of goods receipt labels for mixed purchase orders?

Thank you.

BR

Dirk

entry.title: How to perform currency conversion (e.g. USD → AUD) in S/4HANA Public Cloud Workflow BAdI
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I’m working in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition and need to convert Purchase Requisition (PR) and Service Entry Sheet (SES) total amounts from their document currency to AUD in order to apply Delegation of Authority (DOA) workflow logic.

This conversion needs to happen inside a workflow BAdI class, for example:

  • MM_PUR_S4_PR_WF_AGENTS

  • MM_PUR_S4_SES_WF_AGENTS

What I’ve found so far

  • The Currency Exchange Rates app (F5151) shows all maintained exchange rates.

  • Exchange rates seem to be stored in tables such as TCURR, and there are CDS views like:

    • I_ExchangeRateRawData

    • I_CurrencyExchangeRate

  • I have also found the class CL_EXCHANGE_RATES with method CONVERT_TO_LOCAL_CURRENCY.
    but it does not appear on the released ABAP artifacts list, so I’m hesitant to use it in a Public Cloud extension.

My questions

  1. What is the officially released / supported way to perform currency conversion in S/4HANA Public Cloud (ABAP Extensibility)?

  2. Is CL_EXCHANGE_RATES safe to use in a workflow BAdI for Public Cloud, or is there a released API / CDS that should be used instead?

  3. Has anyone implemented a foreign currency to local currency conversion in a workflow extension for PR or SES approval logic — and if so, what approach did you use?

Context

  • Scenario: DOA logic in PR/SES approval workflow

  • Environment: SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition (3SL)

  • Target: Convert document currency → AUD

  • Need: Compatible with released APIs only

Thanks in advance for any guidance, official SAP note, or example implementation.

entry.title: Can we use 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) without UPA in "Public" Edition?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We are currently considering an ERP replacement from our existing SAP ECC environment to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and I have a question about the relationship between scope item 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) and UPA.

Background:
- Current: SAP ECC environment
- Previous project: S/4HANA Private Cloud Discovery Workshop
→ Decision made NOT to use Universal Parallel Accounting (UPA/6DF)
→ As a result, 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) was marked as "out of scope"

- Current project: S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Discovery Workshop in progress
→ Planning to use standard costing to actual costing processes
→ Therefore, we want to include 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) in scope
→ Customer questioned the difference from the previous project

Questions:
1. Documentation states "UPA is mandatory in Public Edition," but can we use
3F0 alone WITHOUT enabling UPA (6DF)?

2. Or does using 3F0 in Public Edition mean UPA (6DF) must also be enabled
(i.e., they come as a package)?

3. The Administration Guide table shows "Select 3F0 when UPA is enabled,"
but is the reverse scenario possible: "We want to use 3F0 but NOT UPA"?

Referenced Documentation:
- Administration Guide: States that when UPA (6DF) is enabled, 3F0 should also be selected
- Learning Journey: States "UPA is mandatory in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition"

I would appreciate insights from anyone with actual implementation experience
regarding the relationship between 3F0 and UPA in Private Cloud vs. Public Edition.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Cross-Company Code Cost Allocation and Cost Center Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Sc
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We are implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and have questions regarding cross-company code transactions within the same client.

Questions:

1. Cost Allocation Between Company Codes:
- Is it possible to perform cost allocation (assessment/distribution) between different company codes within the same client?
- If yes, which scope item(s) should be activated?
- Which Fiori app(s) should be used?

2. Cost Center Transfer Between Company Codes:
- Is it possible to transfer costs between cost centers in different company codes within the same client?
- If yes, which scope item(s) should be activated?
- Which Fiori app(s) should be used?

What I've found so far:
Based on the blog "Deep Dive: Cross Company topics in Controlling" by Dick Westman, it appears that:
- Universal Allocation (2QL) can be used for cross-company allocations
- Cost Center → Cost Center and Cost Center → WBS allocations are possible
- The "Manage Allocation Cycles" app seems to be the main tool

However, I would appreciate confirmation from anyone with implementation experience:
- Are these the correct scope items for Public Edition?
- Are there any limitations or prerequisites we should be aware?
- Any best practices for setting up cross-company cost allocations?

Thank you in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Lower of Cost or Market Valuation for In-House Manufactured Items (WIP/Semi-Finished Goods) in SAP S
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have questions regarding Lower of Cost or Market (LCM) valuation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Current Operation (ECC environment):
- We perform LCM valuation write-downs for Work in Process (WIP) and semi-finished goods
- These items are manufactured in-house, so they have no purchase prices
- We apply the write-down rate of the parent finished product to calculate write-downs
Example: If Product A has a 10% write-down rate → Apply 10% to its WIP and semi-finished goods

Questions:

1. In Public Edition's standard functionality, is LCM valuation calculated individually for each material code?
Or is there a feature to apply the parent product's write-down rate to WIP and semi-finished goods?

2. For in-house manufactured items (WIP/semi-finished goods), there are no purchase prices.
According to the "Lowest Price Determination Based on Market Price" app (App ID: MRN0),
market prices are retrieved from:
- Goods receipt prices from purchase orders
- Scheduling agreements
- Contracts
- Purchase info records

All of these seem to assume external procurement. Does this mean that
in-house manufactured items without purchase prices are excluded from LCM valuation write-downs?

3. Is there a way to apply LCM valuation to in-house manufactured items?
For example, can we use standard costs or parent product valuation as the basis for write-downs?

4. If the current operation (applying parent product's write-down rate) cannot be achieved with the MRN0 app,
would the workaround be to calculate write-down amounts outside the system and
manually update valuations using 1ZT (Material Price Change and Inventory Value Management)?

Reference Documentation:
- Lowest Price Determination Based on Market Price (App ID: MRN0)
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/7f47a6d9441c46ac86c96fd27f6015f0/7a5fb6531de6b64ce10000000a174cb4.html

I would appreciate any insights from actual implementation experience or workarounds.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Title:"Document Identification When Combining Multiple Standard Reports (SD/MM/FI)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a question regarding document identification when combining multiple standard reports in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Background:
Due to limitations on creating custom reports in Public Edition, we are considering outputting multiple standard reports and linking them by key fields to create a combined document.

Questions:

1. Document numbers can overlap across SD/MM/FI modules. How should we identify documents uniquely?

Example:
- SD Sales Document Number: 1234567890
- MM Purchasing Document Number: 1234567890
- FI Accounting Document Number: 1234567890

2. What combination of fields is required to uniquely identify a document?
- Is Document Number + Document Type sufficient?
- Are Company Code, Fiscal Year, and Organization (Sales Org/Purchasing Org) also required?

3. When linking reports from different modules (e.g., SD report and FI report), what common key fields should be used?
Do we need to use reference document number fields?

4. Are there limitations on which key fields can be output in standard reports?
Are there cases where necessary identification fields cannot be output in certain reports?

I would appreciate any insights from actual implementation experience or best practices.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: How to Track Offsetting Accounts Through Interim Accounts (e.g., Payables → GR/IR → Inventory) in S/
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a question about tracking offsetting accounts through interim accounts in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Scenario:
In the procurement process with GR/IR clearing account, the accounting flow is:

1. Goods Receipt:
DR: Inventory 100
CR: GR/IR Clearing Account 100

2. Invoice Receipt:
DR: GR/IR Clearing Account 100
CR: Accounts Payable 100

Question:
When reviewing Accounts Payable line items, the offsetting account shows "GR/IR Clearing Account." However, we need to trace back to the original offsetting account (Inventory) that was posted when the goods were received.

In other words: Accounts Payable → GR/IR → **Inventory**

Is there a standard way in Public Edition to:
1. Display this multi-level offsetting account relationship in a single report?
2. Download a list showing the complete flow (AP → GR/IR → Inventory)?
3. Automatically link the invoice document to the original goods receipt accounting document?

Current Understanding:
- FI documents only show direct offsetting accounts (1-to-1 relationship)
- Standard reports like "Display Journal Entries" show GR/IR details but don't automatically link to the original inventory posting

Questions:
1. Is there a standard Fiori app or report that can trace through interim accounts?
2. Does the "Manage GR/IR Clearing Account" app (if available) provide this functionality?
3. Would we need to use custom queries via BTP/SAC to achieve this?
4. Are there any best practices for this requirement in Public Edition?

Any insights from actual implementation experience would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Can We Download App ID, Reference Information, and Object Text with Journal Entries/G/L Account Line
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We have a question about downloadable fields when exporting journal entries and G/L account line items in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Background:
We operate with multiple company codes and plants, and need to track:
- Which app was used to post each document
- Whether posting was manual or automatic
- Reference/source information

Questions:

When downloading data from standard apps like:
- Display Journal Entries
- Display G/L Account Line Items

Can we include the following fields in the download?

1. **App ID (Transaction Code equivalent)**
- Which Fiori app was used to create the document
- Example: F0717 (Post General Journal Entries), F1814 (Enter Supplier Invoice)
- Or at minimum: Document Type (SA, KR, DR, etc.)

2. **Reference Processing Information**
- Reference Document Number
- Original Document Number
- Purchase Order Number (for MM documents)
- Sales Order Number (for SD documents)
- Any indicator of manual vs. automatic posting

3. **Object Text**
- Document Header Text
- Line Item Text
- Cost Center Text / WBS Text
- (Clarification: We're also not 100% sure what "Object Text" refers to - any insights?)

Current Understanding:
- App ID is likely NOT stored in FI documents
- Reference document numbers might be available
- Various text fields should be available as selection options

Questions:
1. Which of these fields are actually available in standard journal/G/L reports?
2. Can they be added as columns in the download/export?
3. Are there alternative apps or reports that provide this information?
4. Any workarounds if these fields are not available in standard reports?

We're trying to avoid custom development if possible and want to use standard functionality.

Any insights from actual implementation experience would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Default Formula Keys, Activity Types, and Activity Units Available for Work Centers in SAP S/4HANA C
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We are implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and have questions about the default settings for Work Centers.

Questions:

1. **Default Formula Keys for Work Centers:**
What are the standard/default formula keys available in Public Edition?

From the Help Portal, we found some examples like:
- YBPI01 (Machine Time)
- SAP_02 (Machine)
- SAP_08 (Base Quantity)
- SAP_09 (Operation Quantity)
- SAP_11 (Split)

Is there a complete list of standard formula keys provided by SAP?

2. **Default Activity Types:**
What are the default activity types that can be selected/configured for work centers?
Are there standard activity types provided by SAP, or do we need to create all activity types custom?

3. **Available Activity Units:**
What units of measure can be used for activity types?
Examples: Hours (H), Minutes (MIN), Pieces (PC), etc.
Where can we find the complete list of standard units available?

Background:
We are migrating from ECC and want to understand what standard settings are available in Public Edition to minimize custom configuration.

Note:
Unfortunately, we currently don't have access to the Configuration environment in our system, so we cannot directly check the following Configuration Activities:
- Define formulas for work centers (102002)
- Define standard value key (102003)
- Define Control Key (102001)

Therefore, any insights from your implementation experience or documentation references would be extremely helpful.

Reference:
- Found a Community thread mentioning checking formulas via the Capacities tab in Work Centers
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/how-can-check-work-centre-formula-in-sap-s-4-hana-public-cloud/qaq-p/12811161

Any insights or documentation references would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Where is item that Payment Terms in JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In?
entry.content:
Dear All.

We use JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In in this Project.

I thought that payment information(payment terms, payment method, DueCalculationBaseDate, etc.) is derived by supplier master, but, this is not correct.
Because, As far as I can tell, the payment method was blank and the DueCalculationBaseDate was today.

If there is a way to derive payment information from the vendor, please let me know.
If not, I would like to ask how to enter the payment information.  Is the only option that entry directly to item of payment method, etc.

Best Regards,

entry.title: Field Selection for RFQ Document (Ext. Sourcing Req.) - S4Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi!

My client has a requirement -

They want to make certain fields as Mandatory / Optional when creating a RFQ document for external sourcing.

The reason behind this requirement is that Ext. Sourcing will be carried out by Ariba Team and We as S4Hana users are not concerned about the Mandatory Fields (*). Therefore they want to make certain fields like Quotation Deadline date / company code/ purchase org as optional in the RFQ document. Similarly Target Value / Material / Delivery Address should be marked as Mandatory

 

I have been through Implementation Actives but found no such options to do the customization. 

 

Is there any way to do that? Or do i need to raise this concern to SAP

 

Kindly Guide
